algorithm_technique: Iterative swapping of adjacent nodes using a dummy head and pointer manipulation.
problem_summary_simple: Swap every two adjacent nodes in a linked list without changing node values.
problem_summary_technical: Iteratively swaps adjacent nodes in a singly linked list by re-arranging pointers, using a dummy node for edge cases.
key_insights: Using a dummy node simplifies handling the head of the list.
Careful pointer manipulation is crucial to avoid losing track of nodes during swaps.
The solution modifies node pointers, not values, as required.
